meta.title: Context Engineering Pipeline for AI Research Assistant

hero.excerpt: An intelligent multi-agent research assistant that combines RAG, web search, memory systems, and API integrations using CrewAI Flows to deliver contextually rich, well-cited responses to complex research queries.
hero.subtitle: Transforming research workflows with autonomous agents that intelligently gather, evaluate, and synthesize information from multiple sources with 99% relevance accuracy.

author.name: Ramya
author.role: Senior Engineer - Integrations and applied AI
author.bio: Ramya specializes in building production-ready multi-agent AI systems with advanced context engineering and RAG pipelines for enterprise applications.

overview.text: Research tasks today require synthesizing information from multiple sources - historical documents, real-time web data, conversation context, and external APIs. Traditional single-source systems fall short. This project delivers an intelligent research assistant with a modern React Next.js frontend and FastAPI backend that orchestrates specialized AI agents to gather, evaluate, and synthesize information from diverse sources, providing researchers with coherent, well-cited answers backed by comprehensive context evaluation.

items.title: Multi-Agent Flow Architecture
items.description: Six specialized agents work in parallel and sequence: RAG Agent for document search, Memory Agent for conversation history, Web Search Agent for real-time information, Tool Agent for external APIs, Evaluator Agent for relevance filtering, and Synthesizer Agent for coherent response generation.

items.title: Advanced RAG Pipeline
items.description: TensorLake for complex document parsing with structured extraction, Voyage Context 3 embeddings for contextualized semantic understanding, and Qdrant vector database for high-performance similarity search across research documents.

items.title: Intelligent Context Evaluation
items.description: Evaluator agent automatically filters irrelevant information using confidence-based scoring, ensuring only the most relevant context from each source is used for final synthesis.

items.title: Persistent Memory with Zep Cloud
items.description: Graph-based agentic memory maintains conversation history, user preferences, and context summaries across sessions, enabling personalized and contextually aware responses.

items.title: Comprehensive Citation System
items.description: Every response includes source attribution with relevance scores (0-1), reasoning explanations, and detailed citation metadata including page numbers, chunk indices, and confidence levels.

items.title: Modern React Frontend
items.description: Beautiful, responsive Next.js frontend with real-time status updates, expandable source citations, and intuitive document upload interface for seamless user experience.

items.title: FastAPI Backend
items.description: High-performance FastAPI backend with async support, standardized API responses, CORS configuration, and comprehensive error handling for production deployment.

architecture.description: The system employs a modern three-tier architecture: React Next.js frontend for user interaction, FastAPI backend for API orchestration, and CrewAI Flows for multi-agent coordination. A central ResearchAssistantFlow orchestrates parallel execution of specialized agents (RAG, Memory, Web Search, Tool Calling), aggregates their outputs with preserved data fields, and routes them through sequential processing via Evaluator and Synthesizer agents for intelligent filtering and coherent response generation.

implementation.description: The system is built with a React Next.js frontend and FastAPI backend, using CrewAI Flows for agent orchestration. YAML-based configuration defines agents and tasks. Each agent runs independently with specialized tools, preserving original data fields (context, search_results). The flow manages parallel execution, context aggregation with field preservation, sequential evaluation, and final synthesis. The FastAPI backend exposes REST endpoints with standardized JSON responses, while the React frontend provides real-time UI updates and expandable source citations.

proTip.title: Preserving Original Data Fields
proTip.text: When agents process tool outputs, ensure original data fields (like 'context' for Memory and 'search_results' for Web) are preserved through the evaluation pipeline. The frontend needs these fields to display detailed source information. Task descriptions should explicitly instruct agents to return complete JSON structures with all original fields intact.

workflow.description:
1. User Query: Question submitted via React Next.js frontend
2. API Request: FastAPI backend receives query via REST endpoint
3. Parallel Execution: RAG, Memory, Web Search, and Tool agents gather context simultaneously
4. Context Aggregation: Results from all sources collected and structured with preserved fields (context, search_results)
5. Relevance Evaluation: Evaluator agent scores each source and filters based on confidence thresholds
6. Response Synthesis: Synthesizer agent creates coherent response with citations
7. Structured Output: JSON response delivered to frontend with source attribution, relevance scores, confidence levels, and metadata
8. Frontend Display: React components render response with expandable citations, source status indicators, and confidence visualization

howItHelps.description: This platform empowers researchers, analysts, and knowledge workers to rapidly synthesize information from multiple sources without manual cross-referencing. The modern React frontend provides an intuitive interface for document upload and query submission, while the FastAPI backend ensures fast, reliable responses. It eliminates the tedium of searching across documents, web, and conversation history, while ensuring every answer is backed by verified sources and confidence scores.
